author: Staff Reporter
text:
Stay connected:Collector T.N. Hariharan giving away new Android mobile phones to members of flying squads and static surveillance teams at the Collectorate in Dindigul on Tuesday.— PHOTO: G. Karthikeyan

Wireless system commissioned at the control room for effective surveillance

New Android mobile phones have been given to flying squads and static surveillance teams to monitor election work in Dindigul district.

Distributing the mobile phones to members of these two teams here on Tuesday, Collector T.N. Hariharan said that the public could contact the officials through their new mobile numbers.

Toll-free

Besides, an Android phone was given to the control room to receive complaints through SMS and Whatsapp. A toll-free number, 1800-425-7026, has also been functioning at the control room at the Collectorate.

Wireless system has also been commissioned at the control room for effective surveillance and to pass on necessary information.

Eight flying squads and eight surveillance teams have been constituted for seven Assembly constituencies.

People could contact the control room, static team and special flying squad members to lodge complaints or pass on any information relating to model code violations, for quick action, he also added.
title: New phones for election officials
